question.title: BLE connection drops after ~30s on some Android devices (works fine on iOS and other Android)
question.body:
I am developing an Android app that connects to a custom Bluetooth device using BLE. The issue is:

  • On iOS devices → the connection is stable, no unexpected disconnection.
  • On most Android devices → the connection is also stable and works fine.
  • On some specific Android models (for example, Huawei phones, Xiaomi 14(android-15), etc.) → the device connects successfully and can communicate (send/receive commands) for a while, but it always disconnects after around 30 seconds.

Details:

  • The connection is established via BluetoothGatt.
  • MTU is set (usually 247).
  • Communication works fine before the disconnect.
  • After ~30 seconds, the connection drops automatically without any obvious error from my side.
  • iOS and most Android phones do not have this issue, so it seems related only to certain Android models.
  1. What could cause this kind of consistent ~30s disconnection only on certain Android phones?
  2. Could it be related to Bluetooth security mode / pairing / bonding requirements on those devices?
  3. Are there any known compatibility issues with BLE connections on Huawei or Xiaomi devices that I should be aware of?
  4. What kind of logs or configuration should I check to debug this issue further?

answers.body: This is a common issue with manufacturers implementing aggressive power-saving methods on their devices. The HCI snoop log can help identify why a specific connection was disconnected. In some cases, changing the default settings may resolve this issue.
